page.title: 12THE CROSSENS PUMPING STATION
page.content: THE PUMPING STATION AT CROSSENS WAS FOUNDED BY THOMAS FLEETWOOD OF BANKS. HE BUILT IT IN 1843 AND IT WAS LATER EXTENDED.IT NOW COVERS A VAST AREA AND WAS OPENED IN 1961 BY H.R.H.PRINCESS ALEXANDRA. THERE ARE TWO PUMPS IN NEARBY RUFFORD AND IN HOLMESWOOD AND KEW.THEY PUMP TWO MILLION TONS OF WATER A DAY.THE STATION HAS ITS OWN GENERATOR IN CASE THERE IS A POWER CUT. THERE ARE SEVEN ENGINES. IT IS OWNED BY THE LANCASHIRE RIVER BOARD.IN THE EXCAVATION OF THE NEW PUMPING STATION A HUGE BOULDER WAS FOUND FIVE METRES BELOW THE SURFACE. SCIENTISTS KNOW THAT THE ONLY PLACE WHERE THIS TYPE OF ROCK IS NATIVE IS IN DUMFRIES SO OUR BOULDER MUST HAVE COME FROM A GLACIER DURING THE ICE AGE. THE WORK OF THE STATION IS IMPORTANT AS OUR AREA HAS A LOT OF MARSHLAND AND GOOD DRAINAGE IS ESSENTIAL.
